tn.text: This is the third day after Jesus was buried.
"Sunday"

tn.ref: she saw the stone rolled away
tn.text: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "she saw that someone had rolled away the stone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This phrase appears to be the way that John refers to himself throughout his book. Here the word "love" refers to brotherly love or love for a friend or family member.

tn.ref: They took away the Lord out from the tomb
tn.text: Mary Magdalene thinks that someone has stolen the Lord's body. AT: "Someone has taken the Lord's body out of the tomb" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
John apparently shows his humility by referring to himself here as "the other disciple," rather than including his name.
John implies that these disciples were going to the tomb. AT: "rushed out to the tomb" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
These were the burial cloths that people had used to wrap the body of Jesus.
These were the burial cloths that people had used to wrap the body of Jesus. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jhn:20:03|20:5]].

tn.ref: cloth that had been on his head
tn.text: Here "his head" refers to "Jesus' head." You can translate this in an active form. AT: "cloth that someone had used to cover Jesus' face" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: but was folded up in a place by itself
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "but someone had folded it and put it aside, separate from the linen cloths" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
John apparently expresses his humility by referring to himself as "the other disciple," rather than including his name in this book.

When he saw that the tomb was empty, he believed that Jesus had risen from the dead. AT: "he saw these things and began to believe that Jesus had risen from the dead" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: they still did not know the scripture
tn.text: Here the word "they" refers to the disciples who did not understand the scripture that said Jesus would rise again. AT: "the disciples still did not understand the scripture" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: that he should rise from the dead ones
tn.text: "that said Jesus must rise from the dead"
The disciples continued to stay in Jerusalem. AT: "went back to where they were staying in Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: She saw two angels in white
tn.text: The angels were wearing white clothing. AT: "She saw two angels dressed in white clothing" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"They asked her"

tn.ref: Because they took away my Lord
tn.text: "Because they took away the body of my Lord"

tn.ref: I do not know where they have put him
tn.text: "I do not know where they have put it"
"Jesus asked her"

tn.ref: Sir, if you have taken him away
tn.text: Here the word "him" refers to Jesus. AT: "If you have taken away the body of Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: tell me where you have put him
tn.text: "tell me where you have put it"

tn.ref: and I will take him away
tn.text: Mary Magdalene wants to get Jesus' body and bury it again. AT: "and I will get the body and bury it again" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The word "Rabboni" means rabbi or teacher in Aramaic, the language that Jesus and his disciples spoke.
Jesus used the word "brothers" to refer to his disciples.

tn.ref: I will go up to my Father and your Father, and my God and your God
tn.text: Jesus rose from the dead and then predicted he would go up into heaven, back to his Father, who is God. AT: "I am about to return to heaven to be with my Father and your Father, to the one who is my God and your God" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
These are important titles that describe the relationship between Jesus and God, and between believers and God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:guidelines_sonofgodprinciples]])

tn.ref: Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples
tn.text: Mary Magdalene went to where the disciples were staying and told them what she had seen and heard. AT: "Mary Magdalene went to where the disciples were and told them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It is now evening and Jesus appears to the disciples.

tn.ref: that day, the first day of the week
tn.text: This refers to Sunday.

tn.ref: the doors of where the disciples were, were closed
tn.text: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "the disciples had locked the doors where they were" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

Here "Jews" is a synecdoche for the Jewish leaders who might arrest the disciples. AT: "because they were afraid that the Jewish leaders might arrest them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is a common greeting that means "May God give you peace" (UDB).

tn.ref: he showed them his hands and his side
tn.text: Jesus showed the disciples his wounds. AT: "he showed them the wounds in his hands and his side" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is a common greeting that means "May God give you peace" (UDB).

tn.ref: As the Father has sent me, so I am sending you ... he ... said to them, "Receive the Holy Spirit
tn.text: God the Father sent God the Son who now sends the believers in the power of God the Holy Spirit.
This is an important title for God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:guidelines_sonofgodprinciples]])
You can translate this in an active form. AT: "God will forgive them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"If you do not forgive another's sins" (UDB)
You can translate this in an active form. AT: "God will not forgive them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is a male name that means "twin." See how this name is translated in [[:en:bible:notes:jhn:11:15|11:15]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
The word "him" refers to Thomas.

tn.ref: Unless I see ... his side, I will not believe
tn.text: You can translate this double negative in a positive form. AT: "I will believe only if I see ... his side" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])

tn.ref: in his hands ... into his side
tn.text: The word "his" refers to Jesus.
The word "his" refers to Jesus.
You can translate this in an active form. AT: "when they had locked the doors" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is a common greeting that means "May God give you peace" (UDB).
"without belief" or "without faith"
Here "believe" means to trust in Jesus. AT: "put your trust in me" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Thomas believes that Jesus is alive because he has seen him. AT: "you have believed that I am alive" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This means "God gives great happiness to those" (UDB).
This means those who have not seen Jesus. AT: "who have not seen me alive" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
As the story is nearing the end, the author comments about the many things Jesus did. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_endofstory]])
The word "signs" refers to miracles that show that God is the all-powerful one who has complete authority over the universe.

tn.ref: signs that have not been written in this book
tn.text: You can translate this in an active form. AT: "signs that the author did not write about in this book" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
You can translate this in an active form. AT: "but the author wrote about these signs" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is an important title for Jesus. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:guidelines_sonofgodprinciples]])
Here "life" is a metonym that means Jesus gives life. AT: "you may have life because of Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This refers to spiritual life.
